title: Can the simulated reality theory be disproven? Is the idea that we must be at the bottom of the chain (because we can’t make our own) proof enough to rule out any realistic chances of it occurring? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve already disproved it when I wrote the most authoritative paper on the subject - A Participatory Universe Does Not Equal a Simulated One and Why We Live in the Former . The idea, about where we are in “the chain” is irrelevant because there is no chain. The entire idea is baseless and nothing more than a digitalcentristic fantasy on one hand and a philosophical snow job on the part of Nick Bostrom, on the other. When closely analyzed, it is classic philosophical bollocks. No one, and I repeat, NO ONE has been able to counter the arguments in my paper and they all must be countered in order for simulation theory to have any real legitimacy, because I covered all of the arguments posited in its favor and the evidence presented that supposedly supports it. Simulated reality theory is done like a dog’s dinner. Ask any Aussie what that means…

Virtual beings or simulated reality is conundrum and can’t be disproven precisely , however the fact that we are questioning our Own existence raises some questions. If we were a simulation then the higher race wouldn’t want us to question the reality , In short we wouldn’t be allowed to be self aware. You can refer to below books as well Are You Living in a Simulation? Simulation, Consciousness, Existence

It can’t be disproven because it’s vacuous. The ‘simulated universe’ theory asks, in effect: “What if everything appeared to be exactly the same as it does now?” And the only appropriate answer is: “Well, what if it did?” Theories that have no evidence also have no implications. Why ‘simulated universes’ are a fantasy
Basically, in simulated reality all our experience would be simulated — so you have to prove impossibility of simulating our experience. I cannot see how anyone could ever prove that.
